news_header: Chancellor Rachel Reeves will present Labour's first Budget in 14 years on October 30, involving difficult financial decisions, including tax rises and spending cuts totaling £40bn.
news_text: On October 30, Chancellor Rachel Reeves will deliver Labour's first Budget in 14 years, warning of difficult decisions ahead. The Budget is expected to include £40bn in tax increases and spending cuts. Traditionally, the Chancellor outlines plans for taxes and public spending in the House of Commons. Labour inherited challenging financial circumstances, including a £22bn deficit. The Budget may address various taxes, including National Insurance, Inheritance Tax, Capital Gains Tax, pension taxation, Stamp Duty, and fuel duty. The government aims to boost the economy while maintaining commitments not to raise taxes on working individuals. The Budget speech will be broadcast live, followed by a response from Conservative leader Rishi Sunak.
